prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism** The first part of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. **Step 1: Create the coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] units. This will define the orientation and position of the 2D sketch plane. **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch** Create a new sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. Draw a series of six connected lines to form a closed loop, as follows: - Line 1: Start point at [0.0, 0.0], end point at [0.45, 0.0] - Line 2: Start point at [0.45, 0.0], end point at [0.45, 0.45] - Line 3: Start point at [0.45, 0.45], end point at [0.3, 0.45] - Line 4: Start point at [0.3, 0.45], end point at [0.3, 0.15] - Line 5: Start point at [0.3, 0.15], end point at [0.0, 0.15] - Line 6: Start point at [0.0, 0.15], end point at [0.0, 0.0] This closed loop defines the shape of the prism's base. **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Apply a scaling transformation to the 2D sketch. Set the scaling parameter to 0.45. This will scale the sketch down by a factor of 0.45, resulting in a smaller base for the prism. **Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. This will orient and position the sketch in 3D space. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector to a depth of 0.75 units. This will create a three-dimensional solid model of the rectangular prism. The dimensions of this part are as follows: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.45 units - Height: 0.45 units This completes the instructions for the first part of the CAD assembly. Repeat the process for subsequent parts as necessary, following the instructions provided in the CAD Assembly JSON.</description>

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[-90.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.45,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.45,0.0],"End Point":[0.45,0.45]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.45,0.45],"End Point":[0.3,0.45]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.3,0.45],"End Point":[0.3,0.15]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.3,0.15],"End Point":[0.0,0.15]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.15],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.75,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.45,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
